Project.0: STSP Cluster>Solar Terrestrial Science Programmes, Cluster

Descriptor.0: STA_PPP>Search coil magnetometer and spectrum analyzer

TEXT.0: STAFF (Spatio Temporal Analysis of Field Fluctuations) is one of the five experiments

TEXT.2: The STAFF experiment comprises a boom-mounted three-axis search coil magnetometer to

TEXT.3: measure magnetic fluctuations in the frequency range 0.1 Hz  - 4 kHz, a

TEXT.4: preamplifier and an electronics box that houses the two complementary

TEXT.5: data-analysis packages: a digital Spectrum Analyser, and an on-board waveform

MISSION_DESCRIPTION.0: The aim of the Cluster mission is to study small-scale structures of the magnetosphere

MISSION_DESCRIPTION.1: and its environment in three dimensions. To achieve this, Cluster is constituted of four

MISSION_DESCRIPTION.2: identical spacecraft that will flight in a tetrahedral configuration. The separation distances

MISSION_DESCRIPTION.3: between the spacecraft will be varied between ~3 km and 67 000 km, according to the

MISSION_REFERENCES.0: The Cluster and Phoenix Missions>Cluster project and instrument teams>Space Sci. Rev. 79, Nos. 1-2, 1997

OBSERVATORY_CAVEATS.6: - 2000-09-05T19:39Z/2000-09-05T20:19Z :  WEC Spin up satellite to 22 rpm + sphere release (B.5)

OBSERVATORY_CAVEATS.10: - 2000-10-11T19:15Z/2000-10-11T19:55Z :  WEC Spin up satellite to 22 rpm + sphere release (B.5)

EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION.0: STAFF (Spatio Temporal Analysis of Field Fluctuations) is one of the five experiments

EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION.2: The STAFF experiment comprises a boom-mounted three-axis search coil magnetometer to

EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION.3: measure magnetic fluctuations in the frequency range 0.1 Hz  - 4 kHz, a

EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION.4: preamplifier and an electronics box that houses the two complementary

EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION.5: data-analysis packages: a digital Spectrum Analyser, and an on-board waveform

EXPERIMENT_REFERENCES.0: Cornilleau-Wehrlin N., et al, The CLUSTER Spatio-Temporal Analysis of Field Fluctuations (STAFF) Experiment,Space Sci. Rev., 79, (1-2), 107-136, 1997.

EXPERIMENT_REFERENCES.1: Cornilleau-Wehrlin N., et al, First results obtained by the Cluster STAFF experiment, Ann. Geophys., 21, 437-456, 2003

EXPERIMENT_KEY_PERSONNEL.10: Alain Meyer>STAFF Technical Manager and responsible for Search coils and STAFF SC, passed away>

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.0: The STAFF Spectrum Analyser (SA) combines the 3 magnetic components of the waves with

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.1: the two electric components measured by the EFW experiment to calculate in real

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.2: time the 5x5 Hermitian cross-spectral matrix at 27 frequencies distributed

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.3: logarithmically in the frequency range 8 Hz to 4 kHz. The components in the spin

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.4: plane are despun onboard. The five auto-spectral power estimates are obtained with

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.5: a dynamic range of approximately 100 dB and an average amplitude resolution of

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.6: 0.38 dB. The 10 cross-spectral power estimates are normalised to give the

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.7: coherence. The precision of the phase depends upon the magnitude of the coherence:

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.8: for a signal with magnitude in the highest bin, it is approximately 5 degree close to 0 degree,

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.9: 180 degree, and +/- 90 degree, increasing to about 10 degree midway between these angles. The Spectrum

INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION.10: Analyser can work in different modes, in Burst Mode the analysis is performed in

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.0: STAFF SA electric components may be affected by the EFW preamplifier failure on some of the

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.1: spacecraft. See STAFF UG about EFW failures and data quality (DQ) values used below.

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.2: Definition of data quality (DQ) codes used below, as per STAFF's UG:

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.4: 2  : no saturation - caution to absolute values.

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.5: 2a : one probe is set to zero (density mode, V=0).

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.6: power underestimated : ~0.625 of the power in mV2 m-1 Hz-1.

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.7: 2b : 2 probes are set to zero : power underestimated by a factor of 2

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.8: (~0.5 of the power in mV2 m-1 Hz-1).

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.9: 1  : do not consider band A data (8-64 Hz, the 9 lower frequencies data points)

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.10: because solar aspect angle is close to 90 degrees.

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.11: 0  : one component saturates; do not consider using STAFF-SA's electric component

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.12: or E-field deduced parameters (Poynting Vector component).

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.16: 2002-07-29T09:06:59.000Z/2002-08-08T23:59:59.999Z: Be cautious may saturate (Probe 1 failure). DQ=0

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.17: 2002-08-09T00:00:00.000Z/2011-06-01T09:31:23.999Z: Power to be multiplied by ~1.6 (Probe 1 permanently in density mode, V=0). DQ=2a

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.18: 2011-06-01T09:31:24.000Z/2014-05-18T23:59:59.999Z: Power to be multiplied by ~2 (Probe 3 OFF. Not in density mode). DQ=2b

INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS.19: 2014-05-19T00:00:00.000Z/2025-12-31T23:59:59.999Z: Due to solar aspect angle, DQ=1 if f in band A (8-64Hz), else DQ=2. DQ=1 or 2b

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.1: derived from singular value decomposition (SVD) method

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.2: of the cross-spectral matrix (sm) using the PRASSADCO program

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.4: distributed frequencies between either 8 (or 64) Hz to 4 kHz.

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.5: The SVD  method is described in Santolik et al (2003).

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.6: The parameters calculated from the three magnetic components are

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.7: THSVD, PHSVD, ELLSVD,POLSVD and BSUM. BSUM is the sum of the

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.8: three magnetic auto-power spectra. When BSUM is inferior to

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.9: 1.0E-09 nT^2/Hz, the calculation of the other magnetic dependant parameters

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.10: is meaningless. The theta and phi variables

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.11: are respectively the wave vector polar and azimuthal angles

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.12: in MFA coordinate system. PVSIGN is the direction of the

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.13: Poynting vector component parallel to the magnetic field. It is given

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.14: only when E component is valid. Positive (negative) values correspond

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.15: to a parallel (anti-parallel) Z-component of the Poynting vector.

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.16: ESUM is the the sum of auto-power spectra of the two electric antennae.

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.17: The calculation of PVSIGN is meaningless when BSUM is inferior to

DATASET_DESCRIPTION.19: The change of coordinate system has been done using

Acknowledgement.1: Digital Object Identifier for the STAFF archive: doi.org/10.5270/esa-yrzyijm

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: First nine characters of STAFF Status. See UG, Appendix C. We cannot certify the 9th character (EFW Sweep)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Polar Angle of the direction of propagation in MFA coordinate system (SVD).

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Polar Angle (SVD) in MFA coordinate system

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Azymuthal angle of the direction of propagation in MFA coordinate system (SVD).

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Azymuthal Angle (SVD) in MFA coordinate system

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Degree of polarization in the polarization plane (SVD).

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Degree of polarization in the polarization plane (SVD).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Sum of the three magnetic auto-power spectra.

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Sum of the three magnetic auto-power spectra.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Parallel component of the Poynting vector normalized by its standard deviation.

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Normalized Z-component of the Poynting vector

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Sum of the two electric auto-power spectra.

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Sum of the two electric auto-power spectra.
